question: In a lump sum contract the contractor agrees to execute a complete work
option_a: with all its contingencies in accordance with the drawings and specification for a fixed sum
option_b: without all its contingencies in accordance with the drawings and specification for a fixed sum
option_c: with all its contingencies without any drawings and specification for a fixed sum
option_d: without all its contingencies without any drawings and specification for a fixed sum

question: A schedule of rates is specified in order to regulate
option_a: the amount to be added to or deducted from the fixed sum on account of additions and alterations covered by the contract
option_b: the amount to be added to or deducted from the fixed sum on account of additions and alterations not covered by the contract
option_c: the amount to be added to or deducted from the fixed sum on account of keeping the lump-sum contract within cost likely to incur under completed item of work
option_d: the amount to be added to or deducted from the fixed sum on account of contractor being defaulter.

question: Under Lump-sum detailed measurements of the work done are not required to be recorded except in respect of
option_b: additions and alterations
option_c: work executed is not as per drawing and specification
option_d: All of the above

question: The form of Lump-sum contract is prescribed by
option_a: Government in consultation with its Law Officers.
option_b: before the form is finally determined, the advice of the office of the Chief Controller of Accounts should be sought on the question whether the form proposed meets the requirements of audit / inspection.
option_d: None of the given

question: Whenever the Lump-sum Contract agreement provides for intermediate payment, a certificate should be given by a responsible officer of Government not below the rank of
option_b: Divisional Officer
option_d: Sub-divisional Officer

question: In case where the certificate for intermediate payment on lump-sum contract is given by the Sub-divisional Officer
option_a: Divisional Officer will continue to be responsible for the correctness of payments
option_b: Divisional Accountant will continue to be responsible for the correctness of payments
option_d: Sub-Divisional Officer will continue to be responsible for the correctness of payments

question: State whether true or false The Divisional Officer is required to specify in the bill the method employed by him in estimating the value of work done where making any intermediate payment on a lump-sum contract.
option_b: False

question: In the case of final payments on a lump-sum contract, in addition to a record of detailed measurements in respect of additions and alterations, there should be a certificate of completion of the work according to the prescribed drawings and specification signed by the
option_b: Divisional officer
option_d: All of the above

question: The execution of a work in a border State under the supervision of a responsible Civil Officer without the intervention of the Public Works Department,
option_a: a completion certificate signed by the Civil Officer concerned may be accepted, if he is empowered by the Administrative Ministry / Administrator concerned to sign it.
option_b: a completion certificate signed by the Civil Officer concerned and countersigned by Divisional Officer may be accepted
option_c: On the basis of information and connected document completion certificate shall be signed only the Divisional officer
option_d: Either A or B

question: Pick the Correct one:-
option_a: No payment for additions and alterations shall be made before the completion of the work, even if the detailed measurements of them have been made and the contract provides for that.
option_b: payment for additions and alterations shall be made before the completion of the work, if the detailed measurements of them have been made and the contract provides for that.
option_c: payment for additions and alterations shall be made before the completion of the work, if the detailed measurements of them have been made and the contract provides for that provided that such payment does not exceed the amount involved in lump-sum contract.
option_d: payment for additions and alterations shall be made before the completion of the work, if the detailed measurements of them have been made and the contract provides for that provided that work under lumpsum contract is likely to completed within the same financial year.

question: The forms of bills used for payments in connection with the lump sum contracts are Forms
option_b: CPWA 26 B and CPWA 27B
option_d: CPWA 24, CPWA 27 A and CPWA 27 B

question: Form 27-A is intended for
option_a: intermediate payments on completed item of work
option_b: intermediate payments on lump-sum contract
option_c: Final Payment in respect of completed item of work
option_d: Final Payment in respect of lump-sum contract

question: When secured advances are allowed to a contractor on lump-sum contract, an indenture in Form 31, should invariably be obtained from the contractor and a detailed account of the materials should be kept in
option_b: Part I of CPWA 27A
option_d: No detailed account of material to kept.

question: The certificate on the basis which a secured advance is granted is printed
option_b: at Sl. No. 3 of Part I of CPWA 27-A
option_c: at Sl. No. 3 of Part II of CPWA 27-A
option_d: at Sl. No. 3 of Part III of CPWA 27-A

question: The certificate on the basis which a secured advance is granted must be signed by the officer
option_a: not below the rank of Sub divisional Officer
option_b: above the rank of Sub divisional Officer
option_c: not below the rank of divisional Officer
option_d: above the rank of divisional Officer

question: Which is intended for final payments made to a contractor on lump-sum contract?
In respect of Lump-sum contract,
option_a: maintenance of Work abstract and Register of Work is not required
option_b: maintenance of Work abstract and Register of Work is required in the same manner as contract other than lump-sum contract.
option_c: Work abstract is not required to be maintained whereas Register of Work is required in the same manner as contract other than lump-sum contract.
option_d: Register of Work is not required to be maintained whereas Work abstract is required in the same manner as contract other than lump-sum contract.

question: All ‘intermediate payments’ made to the contactor on lump-sum contract and so acknowledged by him are regarded as
option_b: final payment
option_d: loan and advances

question: Payments for measured up additions and alterations under a lump-sum contract is treated in the account of the work as
option_b: Final Payment
option_d: Any of the given

question: State whether true or false If a percentage or any other portion of the value of works done is withheld as security for the due fulfilment of the terms of the contract, the gross amount before the deduction of the portion withheld should be entered as the advance payment.
option_b: False

question: Value of materials supplied to the contractor or to others on his/her behalf on a lump-sum contract is debited to
option_b: Additional charges for issue of material
option_d: Contractor’s Other-Transaction

question: Which column of Contractor’s Ledger CPWA 43 is intended to show the amount creditable to contractor’s account on account of the value of work done and not required to be posted in case of all intermediate payments on lump-sum contract?
option_b: Column No. 8
option_d: Column No. 7

question: Column No. 10 Contractor’s Ledger need not be posted at all i.e.
option_b: Total value of work or Supplies
option_d: credit

question: The first and last entry which will appear in this column No. 9 of Contractor’s Ledger will be the figure ‘F’ given in
option_a: Part I of the Running bill form 27A
option_b: Part I of the final bill form 27B
option_c: Part II of the Final bill form 27B
option_d: Part II of the Running bill form 27A
